triceps.title: 1. Close-Grip Bench Press
triceps.body: This exercise not only  work on the targeted area, but it will also improve upon your chest and core.
triceps.steps:
Steps :
1. Started with a high plank position with your hands flat on the floor with shoulder-width apart, and wrists under shoulders.

2. Place a yoga block or similar one for elevation 
under your knees.

3. Keeping your body in one long line and bend your arms and lower your body as close to the floor as you can.

4. Push back up to start.

triceps.title: 2. Modified Push-Ups With Yoga Blocks Under Chest
triceps.steps:
Start with a high plank position with your hands flat on the floor about shoulder-width apart and wrists under shoulders.
Place yoga blocks (anywhere between three to one), or similar things if you don't have under your chest.
Then keeping your body in one long line, bend your arms and lower your chest to the blocks.
Push back up to start.

triceps.title: 3. Incline Push-Ups
triceps.body: . In other words, changing the angle so that you're enough higher than the ground makes so that it is easier for you to perform the movement.
triceps.steps:
Take a bench or chair and place it in front of your body.
Place or puts your hands on the chair and walk your feet back until you are at about a 45-degree angle to the chair.
Now keeping your body in one long line, bend your arms and lower yourself as close to the chair as you can.
Push back up to start.

triceps.title: 4. Standard Push-Ups
triceps.body: Keep your neck neutral and aligned with your spine (chin tucked),
triceps.steps:
Start in a high plank position with your hands flat on the floor about shoulder-width apart and wrists under shoulders.
Then keeping your body in one long line, bend your arms and lower yourself as close to the floor as you can. Your elbows should be at about a 45-degree angle to your torso.
Push back up to start.

triceps.title: 5. Wide-Grip Push-Ups
triceps.steps:
Start with a high plank position with your hands flat on the floor a little bit wider than shoulder-width apart and wrists under shoulders.
Keeping your body in one long line, bend your arms and lower yourself as close to the floor as you can.
Push back up to start.
